definition: good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: “The Chinese have been very generous for a long period of time,” Rupert Hoogewerf, who publishes Hurun Report, said by telephone.
sentences.chinese: 中國人長久以來就是非常樂善好施的。

sentences.english: Greece may have benevolent benefactors but I doubt China will be as lenient.
sentences.chinese: 希臘可能有樂善好施的恩人，但我懷疑中國會否寬仁。

sentences.english: Organ websites reflect a surge in the number of Good Samaritans.
sentences.chinese: 器官網站上湧現出許多樂善好施的人。

definition: see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
respect the old and cherish the young
doing good deeds brings the greatest joy (idiom)
